metadata.Title: CVE-2021-42739 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: The firewire subsystem in the Linux kernel through 5.14.13 has a buffer overflow related to drivers/media/firewire/firedtv-avc.c and drivers/media/firewire/firedtv-ci.c, because avc_ca_pmt mishandles bounds checking. Luo Likang discovered that the FireDTV Firewire driver in the Linux kernel did not properly perform bounds checking in some situations. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> CVE-2021-3542 was marked as a duplicate of this CVE, see https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1184673#c17
